subject: Tom Meier Is Back
event: Miniature fans rejoice. Tom Meier has finally found enough time from all his other commitments to sculpt another figure for the Dark Sword range of Ice & Fire miniatures. And this is one you guys have been clamoring for... the Imp himself, Tyrion Lannister. The figure won't actually go on sale for another month or thereabouts, but here's some advance peeks at Tom's green. This is the early Tyrion, as he is when we first meet him in A GAME OF THRONES, before he grows the beard and loses... well, no, that would be telling. Next up for Tom will be Ser Gregor Clegane, the Mountain That Rides, but he has to fit him in among his toy work, so it may not be tomorrow. To make the time pass faster, Dark Sword has some other surprises in the works. But more on that some other day.

comments.article:

And did I read you correctly? "Next up for Tom will be Ser Gregor Clegane, the Mountain That Rides"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

That is fucking awesome, my good sir.

comments.article: Wow, that is so detailed!  The figure really brings Tyrion to life.

I'm amazed by the details (knowing that the figurines are already so tiny, Tyrion must have been quite the challenge to realize!).

Thank you for sharing this and kudos to Tom Meier!
Awesome. It's even to scale.
Oh, that's a fantastic sculpt. It's ridiculous what that man can do in such a small space.

"This is the early Tyrion, as he is when we first meet him in A GAME OF THRONES, before he grows the beard and loses..."

...before he loses his temper? i guess that's what you ment:)

cool miniature!
They got no reason to live.

Really beautiful figure! I thought Tyrion would be much uglier but in fact he almost look dashing there! hee. :D
I'm curious, is it the way you had personally envisioned him or...?

btw, I promised myself to post a link here to a very talented person I know on Deviant who did wonderful illustrations on ASOIAF and doesn't feel herself talented enough to do it herself. She's wrong, of course, if you have half a second to spare, George, please visit her page. Many many thanks. It's worth it.
http://nejna.deviantart.com/

nadine
What a neat miniature!  And it's green---in honor of St. Patrick's Day?
They're all green to start with. You buy them that way and paint them later.
Looks like Bob Hope, but I like it.

Tyrion, then Ser Gregor? I like the range in body size that Tom is exploring with his sculptures.

It's ridiculous what that man can do in such a small space.

Wow.

Oh, awesome! Look at the detail! He's such a fantastic artist... but then, he's got some great material to work from, doesn't he? ;)

is he wearing a wig? Somehow I always envisioned Tyrion as bald, or maybe with a few wisps of blond hair.

YAY TYRION!

comments.article: He'll never nose around in someone else's business again.

Very cool. I almost forgot what Tyrion looked like without a beard.

http://steventill.com
The embroidery detailing looks fantastic.  I'm impressed.

"Randy Newman - Short People"

Heh.

my favorite in ASOIAF are the crows and Tyrion.

but i ask me how anyone can make a miniature of an dwarf?
mini-miniature!!
all miniautures are same size or?
if Tyrion miniature stays beside of Gregor Clegane,we should normally use an magnifying glass.

but maybe only now he has the chance to give Gregor a headbutt.

I think they'll be making them to "scale".  So, Gregor will be much taller than the "regular sized" people and Tyrion (the 28mm version) will be much shorter.  I'm excited by it personally; as you say, most human minis are the same size, even though real people are all different (although go look at some halfling miniatures - they're pretty small, and I'd guess that 28mm Tyrion will be of comparable height).  It'll be good to work on something with some variety.
I love the nod to Olivier's Richard III in this sculpt. I don't know if that was your idea or Tom's, but it was a brilliant touch.
Wow, he looks a lot thinner than I had in my head, but he's got just the right amount of ugliness.  Love the personality in that face!!
Very nice! He'd look right at home sitting up with the gargoyles. :)
